Package com.redis.foundation.ds

Class DSCriteria

java.lang.Object
com.redis.foundation.ds.DSCriteria
public class DSCriteria extends Object
A DSCriteria can be used to express a search criteria for a data source. In its simplest form, it can capture one or more item names, logical operators (equal, less-than, greater-than) and a item values. In addition, it also supports grouping these expressions with boolean operators such as AND and OR.
Since:
1.0
Author:
Al Cole

  • Method Details

    • getCriterionEntries

      public ArrayList<DSCriterionEntry> getCriterionEntries()
      Returns a list of criterion entries currently being managed by the criteria.
      Returns:
      An array of criterion entries.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string summary representation of a criteria.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String summary representation of a criteria.

    • addSpecialEntry

      public void addSpecialEntry(String aFieldName, String anOperator, Object anObject)
      Adds a SmartClient representation of an advanced criterion object to this criteria. This method can handle both Simple and Advanced Criteria objects. In the case of a Simple one (e.g. name/value pairs), you should follow the convention of "FieldName:Data.Operator" and the logic will create a DSCriterion object with the matching entries.
      Parameters:
      aFieldName - Field name.
      anOperator - Logical field operator.
      anObject - Generic representation of the value.

    • toGrid

      public DataGrid toGrid()
      Returns a DataGrid representation of this criteria. Use this method as a convenient way to flatten the hierarchy of criterion objects.
      Returns:
      Simple grid representation of the criteria.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the criteria.
      Returns:
      Criteria name.

    • setName

      public void setName(String aName)
      Assigns the name of the criteria.
      Parameters:
      aName - Criteria name.

    • setCaseSensitive

      public void setCaseSensitive(boolean anIsCaseSensitive)
      Assigns case sensitive flag - used for string comparison operators. The default is true.
      Parameters:
      anIsCaseSensitive - true or false

      public void add(String aName, Data.Operator anOperator, Date aValue1, Date aValue2)
      Convenience method that first constructs a criterion from the parameters and then adds it to the criteria. This method is useful for defining an array of numbers with the BETWEEN operator.
      Parameters:
      aName - Item name.
      anOperator - Criterion operator.
      aValue1 - First Date value.
      aValue2 - Second Date value.

    • add

      public void add(DSCriterionEntry aCriterionEntry)

    • getFirstCriterionByName

      public DSCriterion getFirstCriterionByName(String anItemName)
      Scans the criteria for the first criterion entry that matches the item name. If matched, then the criterion instance is returned.
      Parameters:
      anItemName - Item name to match.
      Returns:
      Data item instance or null.

    • getFirstItemByName

      public DataItem getFirstItemByName(String anItemName)
      Scans the criteria for the first criterion entry that matches the item name. If matched, then the data item instance is returned.
      Parameters:
      anItemName - Item name to match.
      Returns:
      Data item instance or null.

    • isSimple

      public boolean isSimple()
      Returns true if the complete criteria is simple in its nature. A simple criteria is one where all of the boolean operators are AND and all values are single.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • maxCountOfValues

      public int maxCountOfValues()
      Returns the maximum number of values any criterion might have in the criteria. If the criterion does not represent a multi-value, then the count for that entry would be one.
      Returns:
      Maximum count of values.

    • isAdvanced

      public boolean isAdvanced()
      Returns true if the complete criteria is advanced in its nature. An advanced criteria is one where any of the boolean operators are OR or that there are entries with multi-values.
      Returns:
      true or false

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Clears the collection of criterion entries.

    • count

      public int count()
      Returns the count of criterion entries in this criteria.
      Returns:
      Total criterion entries in this criteria.

    • addFeature

      public void addFeature(String aName, String aValue)
      Add a unique feature to this criteria. A feature enhances the core capability of the criteria. Standard features are listed below.
      • Data.FEATURE_OPERATION_NAME
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the feature.
      aValue - Value to associate with the feature.

    • addFeature

      Parameters:

      aValue - Value to associate with the feature.

      Parameters:

      aValue - Value to associate with the feature.

    • enableFeature

      public void enableFeature(String aName)

      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the feature.

    • disableFeature

      public void disableFeature(String aName)

      aName - Name of feature.

      aValue - Feature value to match.

      public final HashMap<String,String> getFeatures()
      Returns a read-only copy of the internal map containing feature list.
      Returns:
      Internal feature map instance.

    • addProperty

      public void addProperty(String aName, Object anObject)
      Add an application defined property to the criteria. Notes:
      • The goal of the DSCriteria is to strike a balance between providing enough properties to adequately model application related data without overloading it.
      • This method offers a mechanism to capture additional (application specific) properties that may be needed.
      • Properties added with this method are transient and will not be persisted when saved.
      Parameters:
      aName - Property name (duplicates are not supported).
      anObject - Instance of an object.

    • getProperty

      public Object getProperty(String aName)
      Returns the object associated with the property name or null if the name could not be matched.
      Parameters:
      aName - Name of the property.
      Returns:
      Instance of an object.

    • clearProperties

      public void clearProperties()
      Removes all application defined properties assigned to this bag.

    • getProperties

      public HashMap<String,Object> getProperties()
      Returns the property map instance managed by the criteria or null if empty.
      Returns:
      Hash map instance.
